intro: Oenothera acuticarpa, commonly known as the sharp-fruited evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom at night. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oval seeds. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs. Oenothera acuticarpa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and disturbed areas.
